required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Human Metabolic Dynamics at Rest and During Aerobic Exercise Under Normobaric Normoxic and Moderate Hypoxic Conditions
clinical_study.official_title: MetaboDyn- Liquid-liquid Extraction of Single Drops of Whole Capillary Blood as a Reliable Method of Measuring Metabolic Effects of Exercise: A Pilot Study.

collaborator.agency: Max Delbrück Center for Molecular Medicine in the Helmholtz Association (MDC) Berlin

brief_summary.textblock: The aim is to define in detail metabolic pathways at rest and during aerobic exercise in normal and healthy men and women under normobaric normoxic and moderate hypoxic conditions, using metabolomics technologies based on minimally invasive sampling relying on gas chromatography and mass spectrometry.

primary_outcome.measure: Coefficient of variation of relative quantities of metabolites and physiological parameters related to its dynamic during exercise under normoxic and hypoxic conditions, using GC-MS.
primary_outcome.description: A drop of capillary blood (20 µl) will be collected from the hyperemic earlobe for metabolomic analysis at the times t = 0 min (before starting), 10 min, 20 min and 30 min during the activity, and t = 50 and 60 min taken in the recovery phase. The oxygen saturation and heart rate will be determined at the same time points by pulse oximetry and heart rate monitoring, as well as blood gas analyses and subjective self-perception of energy availability on a quantitative scale throughout exercise.

intervention.description: The subjects arrive in the CRU after a 12 hours overnight fast to perform a 30-minute movement activity with individually adapted exercise intensity on the treadmill.

The 30-minute movement activity on the treadmill will be completed by each subject once under normobaric normoxic and once under normobaric hypoxic conditions (equivalent to approximately 3000 meters above sea level) in a randomized episode.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- approval and written, informed consent
- healthy adults of varying fitness levels (age >18 years to 75 years)
Exclusion criteria:
- chronic illness requiring any medication
- pregnancy
- limitations regarding functioning in the hypoxic chamber
- inability to follow simple instructions
- relevant or severe abnormalities in medical history, physical examination, ECG routine laboratory parameters from blood and urine

facility.name: Charité University Experimental & Clinical Research Center

patient_data.ipd_description: Liquid-liquid extraction of single drops of whole capillary blood with collaborator partner MDC
